description: From Middle English ymne, from Old English ymen (reinforced by Old French ymne), from Latin hymnus, borrowed from Ancient Greek ὕμνος (húmnos).

entries.meaning: A song of praise or worship, especially a religious one.

verbs.description: hymn (third-person singular simple present hymns, present participle hymning, simple past and past participle hymned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To praise or extol in hymns.
examples: To hymn the birth-night of the Lord.
